sponsor.partnerMessage: Bowen Dental Studio is a dental office unlike anything you've experienced. Their patients receive personalized, compassionate care from one of the most highly-skilled dentists in the area. They prioritize listening to and caring for their patients. Learn more here.

posts.title: Weekend Roundup
posts.content:
Happy Friday! Here is a rundown of some events and fun things happening this weekend...

  • Hog fam: Get hype at the Razorback Fan Fest this Saturday down in Little Rock as the Hogs take on UAPB!*
  • Outdoor market: Weekend farmer's markets are still in full swing and a must visit.
  • Pick up: Attend a community clean up event this weekend in Springdale or Rogers. Keep NWA beautiful!
  • Movie: Get in the Halloween spirit with a family movie day at Big Sexy Food in Springdale.
  • Shady: Pick up your free new tree or plant this Saturday in one of the many NWA communities.
  • Groovy: There is a free music and arts festival this Saturday at Prairie Street Live.
  • Green thumbs: Garden at Crystal Bridges on Saturday with a nature specialist.

Have a great weekend and we will see you Monday!

posts.title: Inside And Out
posts.content:
Health leaders have determined mental health a nation emergency. Here in Northwest Arkansas mental health and substance use services for children and adults are a priority. 

  • Local healing: The Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration (SAMHSA) awarded Springdale-based nonprofit Ozark Guidance a 2 year, $5m grant to continue to address mental illness in the region.
  • Health Initiative: The SAMHSA is a branch of the US Department of Health and Human Services distributing $825m to 231 community health centers across the country.

Click HERE for more information.

posts.title: Pedal Gang
posts.content:
OZ, the Ozark Outdoor Foundation, and the Bentonville Public Library are hosting a race for kids tomorrow and registration is still open. 

  • Race: The racing categories are: balance bikes (5 years and under), pedal, and AWA/para-cycling. The fastest three times in each category will have opportunity to stand on a podium and collect a trophy!
  • Party: The event will be more than just a race with festival activities, crafts, discovery play, yoga, food, live music and more! NWACC Bicycle Tech program is hosting a ‘fix a flat’ competition between bike shops, and providing space to let kids tinker on bikes. 

For more information, and to register your kid for chance to win big, click HERE.

posts.title: Canoe For Community
posts.photoCredit: Crystal Bridges Museum of American Art
posts.content:
Starting today until Nov. 19 Crystal Bridges is inviting you to watch and learn about the Marshallese culture in Northwest Arkansas. 

  • Carving: A master boat builder and his team will transform a tree into a water-ready canoe, and you're invited to witness. The carvers will be available each Friday from 4-5p until the vessel is finished to talk about the building process. 
  • Celebrating culture: There will be opening and closing ceremonies to mark the beginning and end of the project that include Marshallese dance and musical performances led by local community leaders. There is no registration required. 

For more information, click HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Eat Local Beef: Order local grass-fed beef to be delivered right to your door.*
  • Clean up: Get rid of your bulky waste this Saturday.
  • Gold: The Arkansas Razorback soccer team are SEC champs.
  • B&B: Say goodbye to Airbnbs in Eureka Springs.
  • Growing: The City of Fayetteville is seeking input on a community center expansion.
  • Conserve: Eureka Springs is restoring a historic dam.
  • Art: Do you know where in Bentonville this new mural is?
  • Feature: Check out our advertisement deals to see about a spot in our newsletter!

*content is sponsored
